alert.note: Alert for Canadian; Cleveland; Kingfisher; Lincoln; Logan; Oklahoma; Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 2:41AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong winds will impact portions of southeastern Kingfisher, northwestern Lincoln, Oklahoma, northwestern Cleveland, Logan, southwestern Payne and northeastern Canadian Counties through 330 AM CDT... At 240 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking the leading edge of winds from strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Crescent to near Cashion to near Oklahoma City. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oklahoma City, northern Norman, Edmond, Moore, Midwest City, Stillwater, Del City, Guthrie, Bethany, Mustang, Choctaw, Warr Acres, The Village, Piedmont, Harrah, Spencer, Nichols Hills, Perkins, Jones and Nicoma Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 117 and 172. Interstate 40 between mile markers 141 and 167. Interstate 44 between mile markers 112 and 159. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These winds may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
